phylojunction.distribution package

Submodules

phylojunction.distribution.dn_discrete_sse module

class phylojunction.distribution.dn_discrete_sse.DnSSE(sse_stash: SSEStash, stop_value: List[float] = [], n: int = 1, n_replicates: int = 1, stop: str = '', origin: bool = True, start_states_list: List[int] = [], condition_on_speciation: bool = False, condition_on_survival: bool = True, condition_on_obs_both_sides_root: bool = False, min_rec_taxa: int = 0, max_rec_taxa: int = 1000000000000, abort_at_obs: int = 1000000000000, seeds_list: Optional[List[int]] = None, epsilon: float = 1e-12, runtime_limit: int = 15, debug: bool = False)

Bases: DistributionPGM

Distribution class for State-dependent Speciation and Extinction (birth-death) process

The sampling method in this class is a “rising tide” simulator, where all living lineages grow together.

At all times we know: (i) how many lineages are alive and dead, and (ii) all the character states represented by living lineages

This is not a recursive simulator (in which each lineage would take care of growing only itself, and recur upon birth events).

sse_stash

Object holding all state-dependent parameters we need to simulate.

Type

SSEStash

n

Number of simulations one wants.

Type

int

n_replicates

Number of tree replicates per simulation.

Type

int

stop

If “age”, stops when origin or root age is equal to ‘stop_condition_value’. If “size”, stops when tree has ‘stop_condition_value’ observable nodes.

Type

str

stop_val

Either maximum tree age, or maximum count of observable nodes.

Type

float

start_at_origin

Simulation starts at origin (i.e., seed == origin).

Type

bool

start_states

List of integer representing the starting states of all n_sim simulations.

Type

int

state_count

Number of discrete states (obtained from ‘events’).

Type

int

n_time_slices

Number of time slices (obtained from ‘events’).

Type

int

slice_t_ends

List of end times from time slices (obtained from ‘events’).

Type

int

condition_on_speciation

If true, rejects trees that go extinct before reaching stop_condition_value. Defaults to False.

Type

bool

condition_on_survival

If true, rejects trees that go extinct before reaching stop_condition_value. Defaults to True.

Type

bool

condition_on_obs_both_sides_root

If true, rejects trees that do not have observed taxa on both sides of complete tree’s root. Defaults to False.

Type

bool

min_rec_taxa

Required minimum number of observed taxa in reconstructed tree (at least or equal to). Defaults to zero.

Type

int

max_rec_taxa

Required maximum number of observed taxa in reconstructed tree (at most and equal to). Defaults to 1e12.

Type

int

abort_at_obs

If growing tree reaches this number of living taxa, we abort the sample (invalidate the tree). Defaults to 1e12.

Type

int

epsilon

Any values difference below this value is set to 0.0. Defaults to 1e-12.

Type

float, optional

runtime_limit

Maximum number of minutes one is willing to wait until all ‘n_sim’ simulations are done. Defaults to 5.

Type

int, optional

debug

Whether to print debugging messages

Type

bool, optional

Sample (simulate) tree with states at its terminal nodes]

Parameters

  • a_start_state (int) – State at seed node (origin or root)

  • a_stop_value (float) – Value to stop simulation with (number of tips or tree height)

  • sample_idx (int) – Sample index (i.e., simulation index)

Returns

One simulated tree.

Return sample from exponential distribution.

Parameters

  • n_draws (int) – Number of draws (sample size).

  • scale_or_rate_param (float) – Scale (default) or rate of exponential distribution.

  • rate_parameterization (bool, optional) – Argument of ‘scale_or_rate_param’ is rate instead of scale. Defaults to True.

Returns

Sample (list) from exponential distribution.

Return sample from gamma distribution

Parameters

  • n_draws (int) – Number of draws (sample size)

  • shape_param (float) – Gamma distribution shape parameter (represented by alpha or kappa sometimes).

  • scale_or_rate_param (float) – Gamma distribution scale or rate parameter.

  • rate_parameterization (bool, optional) – Argument of ‘scale_or_rate_param’ is rate instead of scale. Defaults to False.

class phylojunction.distribution.dn_parametric.DnLogNormal(n_draws: int, n_repl: int, ln_mean: List[float], ln_sd: List[float], ln_log_space: bool, parent_node_tracker: Optional[Dict[str, str]])

Bases: DistributionPGM

DN_NAME = 'Log-normal'
static draw_ln(n_draws: int, mean_param: float, sd_param: float, scale: float = 1.0, log_space: bool = True) → Union[float64, ndarray]

Return sample from log-normal distribution.

Parameters

  • n_draws (int) – Number of draws (sample size).

  • mean_param (float) – Mean (location) of log-normal in log-space.

  • sd_param (float) – Std. deviation (shape) of log-normal distribution in log-space.

  • scale (float) – Median (scale) of log-normal distribution in log-space. Defaults to 1.0.

  • log_space (bool, optional) – Mean and std. deviation are provided in natural space. Defaults to True.

Returns

Sample (list) from log-normal distribution.

Return type

list of float(s)
